1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Report abort reasons.
4--
5-- Abortable process returns @Left@ 'B.AbortReason' when aborted.
6-- The 'B.abortable' function adds code positions to the reason.
7-- 'abortPrint' outputs aborted message in the following format.
8--
9-- > **
10-- > ** ABORTED  {reason}
11-- > ** -------- ---------------------------------- ------
12-- > ** Detail   {description}
13-- > **          {description}
14-- > **
15-- > ** Source   {line}.{char} {path}
16-- > **            {before}
17-- > **                {after}                      {tag}
18-- > **
19-- > **          {line}.{char} {path}
20-- > **            {before}
21-- > **                {after}                      {tag}
22-- > **
23-- > ** Command  {program}
24-- > **          {arg}
25-- > **          {arg}
26-- > **
27-- >
28-- > === note
29-- > 
30-- > {note}
31-- > {note}
32-- > 
33-- > === rel
34
35module Koshucode.Baala.Base.Abort.Report
36  ( -- * Message
37    CommandLine,
38    cpMessage,
39    abortMessage,
40    abortPrint,
41
42    -- * Abort
43    abort,
44    abortCommand,
45    abortLeft,
46    bug,
47  ) where
48
49import Koshucode.Baala.Overture ((&))
50import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture             as O
51import qualified Koshucode.Baala.System               as O
52import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.List            as B
53import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Text            as B
54import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Abort.CodePos   as B
55import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Abort.Reason    as B
56
57
58-- --------------------------------------------  Message
59
60-- | Command name and its arguments.
61type CommandLine = [String]
62
63-- | Create position and line information.
64cpMessage :: B.CodePosInfo -> [(String, B.AbortTag)]
65cpMessage (cp@B.CodePos { B.cpLineNo = lno }, tag)
66    | lno <= 0      = []
67    | null before'  = [ trunc pos     & ""
68                      , indent after' & tag
69                      , "" & "" ]
70    | otherwise     = [ trunc pos      & ""
71                      , indent before' & ""
72                      , indent after'  & tag
73                      , "" & "" ]
74    where
75      trunc   = O.truncateString 48
76      indent s = "  " ++ trunc s
77      pos     = show lno ++ "." ++ show cno ++ " " ++ O.getIOPath cp
78      cno     = B.cpColumnNo cp
79      before' = O.trimBegin before
80      after'  = replicate (min 4 $ length before') ' ' ++ O.trimBegin after
81      (before, after) = B.cpSplit cp
82
83-- | Convert abort reason to message lines.
84abortMessage :: CommandLine -> B.AbortReason -> [String]
85abortMessage cmd a = B.squeezeEmptyLines $ map O.trimEnd texts where
86    texts  = sandwich "" "" $ B.renderTable " " tab ++ note
87    tab    = B.alignTable $ title : rule : rows
88    title  = [ B.textCell B.Front "ABORTED "
89             , B.textCell B.Front $ B.abortReason a ]
90    rule   = [r, r, r]
91    r      = B.textRuleCell '-'
92    p text = (text, "")
93    rows   = concatMap row
94             [ "Detail"  & detail $ B.abortDetail a
95             , "Source"  & source $ B.abortPoint a
96             , "Command" & p <$> cmd ]
97
98    row :: (String, [(String, String)]) -> [[B.Cell]]
99    row (_, []) = []
100    row (name, xs)
101        = let (codes, tags) = unzip xs
102          in [[ B.textCell      B.Front name
103              , B.textBlockCell B.Front codes
104              , B.textBlockCell B.Front $ map dots tags ]]
105
106    detail [] = []
107    detail ln = p <$> ln ++ [""]
108
109    source :: [B.CodePosInfo] -> [(String, B.AbortTag)]
110    source = concatMap cpMessage . B.unique . reverse
111
112    dots :: O.StringMap
113    dots ""   = ""
114    dots text = ".. " ++ text
115
116    sandwich :: a -> a -> O.Map [a]
117    sandwich open close xs = open : xs ++ [close]
118
119    note = case B.abortNote a of
120             n | n == []   -> []
121               | otherwise -> "" : "Note" : "" : (("  " ++) <$> n)
122
123-- | Print abort message.
124--
125-- Prepare code position and abort reason.
126--
127--   >>> let cp = B.CodePos 0 "<stdin>" 1 "abcdefg" "defg"
128--   >>> let Left a = B.abortable "tag" cp $ Left $ B.abortBecause "Bad luck"
129--
130-- Print it.
131--
132--   >>> abortPrint (words "prog x y") a
133--   **
134--   **  ABORTED  Bad luck
135--   **  -------- ----------- ------
136--   **  Source   1.3 <stdin>
137--   **             abc
138--   **                defg   .. tag
139--   **
140--   **  Command  prog
141--   **           x
142--   **           y
143--   **
144--
145abortPrint :: CommandLine -> B.AbortReason -> IO ()
146abortPrint cmd a = B.putCommentLines $ abortMessage cmd a
147
148
149-- --------------------------------------------  Abort
150
151-- | Stop program execution abnormally.
152abort :: B.AbortReason -> IO x
153abort a =
154  do (prog, args) <- O.progAndArgs
155     abortCommand (prog : args) a
156
157-- | Abort with a command line.
158abortCommand :: CommandLine -> B.AbortReason -> IO x
159abortCommand cmd a =
160  do abortPrint cmd a
161     B.putCommentLines ["Exit with status 2", ""]
162     O.exit 2
163
164-- | Abort when getting abort reason.
165abortLeft :: B.Ab b -> IO b
166abortLeft (Right b)  = return b
167abortLeft (Left a)   = abort a
168
169-- | Stop on error @'BUG DISCOVERED'@
170bug :: String -> a
171bug msg = error $ "BUG DISCOVERED: " ++ msg
172
